textos_fuente.text: Ocoee Lakeshore Center Call Us 407-877-5803 125 N Lakeshore Drive, Ocoee Florida Reservations@ocoee.org Follow Us ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR ABOUT US EVENTS VENUE Lakeshore Center Withers Maguire House Outdoor Options Ison Center GALLERY BLOG CONTACT SCHEDULE TOUR Discover the perfect setting for your event at the Ocoee Lakeshore Center! Constructed in 2014 and renovated in 2019, our facility boasts two separate and unique indoor rental options and three beautiful outdoor locations providing flexibility for any occasion. We are a proud part of the City of Ocoee routinely hosting local professional events, breathtaking weddings, and community happenings. Take a closer look at all we have to offer and we are excited to provide the perfect backdrop for your unforgettable event! Read More Venue Options LAKESHORE CENTER Overlooking Starke Lake our facility boasts a 400 person ballroom, breathtaking Lakeview indoor space, two ready rooms, a stunning catering kitchen, and a wrap-around porch. Perfect for any style event from professional to personal gatherings. Learn More WITHERS-MAGUIRE HOUSE Built in 1888 this historic house is one of Orange County‚Äôs oldest homes. It has been updated with a modern kitchen and restroom while the remainder of the house retains its original charm. Perfect for smaller more intimate events with a unique flare of history. Learn More OUTDOOR OPTIONS Three different outdoor options for all event sizes. Bill Breeze Park is one acre of open space for any type of event or festival. The Wedding Pavilion and lawn is the perfect setting for ‚ÄúI Do‚Äù while the Outdoor Garden is a smaller area shaded by beautiful oak trees for intimate gatherings or extra outdoor space. Learn More EVENTS WITH WATERFRONT VIEWS¬†AND¬†GRAND BALLROOMS With so many different indoor and outdoor options, come and see us in person to start planning your perfect event! Schedule a Tour Ocoee Lakeshore Center Blogs Keep up with news, trends, and unforgettable moments with our dynamic publications! July 15, 2025 Summer Soir√©es & Cocktail Hours: Enjoy the Summer Before It Slips Away! beatcreative June 30, 2025 Small Meetings, Big Impact: Utilizing OLC‚Äôs Intimate Spaces for Workshops and Seminars beatcreative May 28, 2025 Making Your Milestone Moments Shine: Host Birthday Parties and Anniversaries at Ocoee Lakeshore Center beatcreative #TipTuesday ‚û°Ô∏è It's time to start planning you A vibrant jazz brunch filled with music, food, and Happy Labor Day from Ocoee Lakeshore Center! üíô Our Lakeview room is the perfect canvas for unforg üé∂ Brunch, jazz, and a whole lot of Rattler prid Dream venue, dream party! ü´∂üíú Amanda's gradua Pure elegance! ‚ú® This gold and white wedding her We can‚Äôt stop watching this reception entrance b Swipe to see the excitement from the Hob Nob & Str This throwback wedding is giving us major fall vib Watch Amanda shine as she enters her graduation pa New Blog Alert! üö® Your dream event awaits at th TESTIMONIALS "Beautiful place. Recently renovated. Love the staff, place, view and all the newly renovated technology ‚ù§" TIFFANY Bride "The ladies at Ocoee were so extremely helpful. The venue is very picturesque, I loved the bridal suite at Withers-Maguire House and the main building where the reception was held was immaculate. The value is great and anyone that is looking to have a fabulous wedding and is on a budget would be very happy with the Ocoee Lakeshore Center." TRINETTE Bride Contact Us Today to Book your Event! Facilitating community building through hosting events and occasions, come plan your stunning event with us. The Ocoee Lakeshore Center features several indoor and outdoor spaces suitable for all types and sizes of events, with most of the spaces being available as a package or separately based on your desires and event size. CONTACT US TODAY TO BOOK YOUR EVENT! Complete the form below and one of our event coordinators will contact you shortly! How did you hear about us? Social Media Friend/Family Google Search Attended Previous Event Perfect Wedding Guide Wedding Venue Map The Knot Wedding Wire Other 407-877-5803 Reservations@ocoee.org 125 N Lakeshore Drive, Ocoee, Florida 34761 OFFICE HOURS Monday ‚Äì Friday: 8:00 am ‚Äì 5:00 pm About Us The expanded Ocoee Lakeshore Center and the surrounding greens are a space for you to come together to celebrate life‚Äôs special events, spend time with those you love, and meet new neighbors. Welcome to ‚Äúthe center of good living!‚Äù CONTACT US 125 N Lakeshore Drive Ocoee, Florida 34761 Phone: 407-877-5803 Fax: 407-877-5801 Email: reservations@ocoee.org Photos & Videos featured provided by: jerzynieves.com stellememories.com aislesandivy.com Accessibility Statement ¬©2024 Ocoee Lakeshore Center - All Rights Reserved

About Us | Ocoee, FL Skip to Main Content Search City of Ocoee Phone: 407-905-3100 1 North Bluford Avenue, Ocoee, FL 34761 About Us Events Programs Facilities Parks Community Relations Home City Government Departments Parks & Leisure Services About Us About Us The City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services Department strives to provide the citizens of Ocoee with safe and enjoyable programs, parks and facilities that will enhance the quality of life for city residents and promote an overall sense of community. We are committed to providing quality recreational services and welcome your comments, suggestions and ideas. Ocoee Lakeshore Center The Ocoee Lakeshore Center is West Orange County‚Äôs premier event destination. From wedding to conventions, the Lakeshore Center can host your event in style. Enjoy lovely lake views and modern amenities from all areas of our facility. The Lakeshore Center features banquet seating for more than 200 people, a modern catering kitchen, additional rooms for use and a state of the art audio-visual system. The historic Withers-Maguire House is suited for bridal party preparations and smaller meetings and events. For more information contact the Parks and Leisure Services Administrative office at 407-877-5803. Facilities The Parks and Leisure Services Department manages six recreation centers located throughout the city. A variety of programs for youth, adults and seniors are offered at these centers throughout the week. All centers are available during weekday evenings and on weekends to rent for family gatherings, parties, meetings, receptions, banquets and other special occasions. For more information contact the Parks and Leisure Services Administrative office at 407-877-5803. Parks The Parks and Leisure Services Department operates and maintains thirteen parks throughout the city with some of the following amenities: picnic areas, playgrounds, basketball and tennis courts, baseball, softball, football and soccer fields, and pavilions. Discover a park close to you. Programs The Parks and Leisure Services Department provides a variety of year-round recreational programs and events for youth , adults and seniors to enhance the quality of life for the residents of Ocoee. For more information on the programs and classes, please contact the Jim Beech Recreation Center at 407-905-3180 or check out our Facebook Page . Family Aquatic Center The Ocoee Family Aquatic Center provides a safe and relaxing setting for families to enjoy their day. Special features include a zero depth entry for easy access and spray features for the kids to splash the day away. For more information on programs and classes at the aquatic center, contact the Jim Beech Recreation Center at 407-905-3180. Ocoee Music Festival The City of Ocoee‚Äôs Fall Music Festival is celebrated annually drawing more than 20,000 people each year. The festival includes both local and national entertainment and one of the best fireworks displays in Central Florida. It is non-stop fun! For more information please contact Mark Johnson , Parks & Leisure Services Director or check the Festival website . Contact Us Mark Johnson Parks and Recreation Director Email Dan Abdo Parks Operations Manager Email Toren Hogan Recreation Operations Manager Email 1 N. Bluford Ave Ocoee, FL 34761 Directions Ph: 407-877-5803 Hours Monday - Thursday 7:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Friday 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Staff Directory Parks & Recreation Advisory Board Helpful Links Accessibility Employment Site Map Ocoee CRA Website /QuickLinks.aspx FAQs How many counselors and/or children can I bring? How many counselors do I need to have? What days can I schedule a visit? How can I pay for my camp visit? What happens if it is raining or there is a storm prior to or during my visit? /FAQ.aspx Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing. Things to do in Ocoee 5. Schools in Ocoee 6. Ocoee, FL. Homes For Sale Introduction to Ocoee Ocoee, Florida is a small city located in Orange County, just outside of Orlando. It's a popular spot for homeowners who want to live in a tight community while also having all the amenities of a large city nearby. Where is Ocoee, Florida More About Ocoee The area was first settled in 1840 and was originally known as Starke Lake. But it wasn't until 1887 that the town was officially called Ocoee. The name comes from Lake Ocoee, located within the city limits and has been used for recreational activities for over a century. Today, the town has grown to encompass an estimated population of 36,000 people. Ocoee is known for its vibrant community; many residents participate in regular events such as the annual Turkey Trot 5k/10k run and biking events like Tour de Ocoee. There are also plenty of outdoor activities at nearby lakes and parks, such as fishing, kayaking, paddle boarding, nature trails, and more. Regarding business opportunities, Ocoee offers many retail outlets, including antique shops and specialty boutiques alongside national chains like Bed Bath & Beyond and Dick's Sporting Goods. The West Oaks Mall provides locals with more extensive store options, including department stores like JC Penny's, Macy's, and other retailers. Ocoee prides itself on being an inviting city by cultivating a vibrant culture through engaging community-driven initiatives like lending libraries, public art projects, farmers' markets, and festivals throughout the year. With so much to offer visitors and locals alike, it's no wonder why Ocoee is fast becoming one of Central Florida's must-live locations! Things to do in Ocoee Bill Breeze Park West Orange Trail Toll Road Brewing Family Aquatic Center Jim Beech Recreation Center Schools in Ocoee Although these schools are located in the City of Ocoee, school zones are set by the school district. You can find Orange county schools here . Elementary Ocoee Elementary School Citrus Elementary School Spring Lake Elementary School Wesbrooke Elementary School Thornebrooke Elementary School Middle Ocoee Middle School High Ocoee High School Private Innovation Montessori Ocoee Hope Charter School Renaissance Charter School at Crown Point Legacy Charter High School Ocoee, FL. Special Events | Ocoee, FL Skip to Main Content Search City of Ocoee Phone: 407-905-3100 1 North Bluford Avenue, Ocoee, FL 34761 About Us Events Programs Facilities Parks Community Relations Home City Government Departments Parks & Leisure Services Events Special Events Special Events Please subscribe to our calendar to stay up to date on our latest events. Special Events Food and Beverage Vendor Application Thank you for considering becoming a vendor with us! We are excited to learn more about you and your business. City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services hosts several special events throughout the year. Please take a moment to read more about Parks and Leisure Services' special events and submit your application . For more information contact Adrian Dorsey or Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Community Market Come out and enjoy the new Community Market on the first Thursday of every month from 5 pm-9 pm. The Market will be located at Bill Breeze Park (125 N Lakeshore Drive, Ocoee, FL, 34761). There will be food trucks, artisan snacks, handmade goods, and live music. This event is managed by Orange Blossom Market CO in partnership with the City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services . For more information, contact Sheena Willis . Halloween Howl Night City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host Halloween Howl Night on Friday, October 24, 2025, from 6:00 pm -9:00 pm. The event will include a Trunk or Treat, glow hunt, food trucks, costume contest, games, & more. For more information contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Ocoee Music Festival City of Ocoee‚Äôs Fall Music Festival is celebrated annually, drawing more than 20,000 people each year. The festival includes both local and national entertainment and one of the best fireworks displays in Central Florida. It is non-stop fun! For more information, please Email Mark Johnson , Parks and Leisure Services Director, or check the Festival website. Dash of the Century 5K The City of Ocoee will host a once-in-a-lifetime Dash of the Century 5K on Saturday, November 15, 2025. Join us for a historic 5K celebrating 100 years of community, pride, and progress. The race will take place in Downtown Ocoee, with warmups starting around 7 am and the race starting at 7:30 am. Register here Version OptionsSpecial EventsHeadline Dash of the Century 5K Dash of the Century 5K . For more information, email Tracy Wise-Donahey or contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Evening with Santa City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host an Evening with Santa. Event Date and Time To Be Announced. The event will be held at the Ocoee Lakeshore Center. Enjoy a visit with Santa and his special guests, and share Christmas wishes, pictures, and much more. Space is limited . Registration is currently closed. For more information, contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Jolly Jamboree & Tree Lighting City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host its Annual Jolly Jamboree & Tree Lighting Event on Saturday, December 13, 2025, from 1:00 pm-7:00 pm. This free event will feature Santa‚Äôs Village, a kids' zone, special guests, tree lighting, and much more. For more information, contact Adrian Dorsey or Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Dog Parade City of Ocoee Parks & Leisure Services will host its Third Annual Holiday Dog Parade on Saturday, December 13, 2025. Judging will start at 1:30 pm. Registration will open on Saturday, November 1, 2025. Additional event details will be emailed to all registered particip ants. For further information and assistance with registration, contact Adrian Dorsey or Parks & Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Highlighting Ocoee City of Ocoee Parks & Leisure Services Advisory Board meets on two (2) designated dates in December from 6:00 pm ‚Äì 8:30 pm to view and judge the homes with the best Christmas lights in the city. If chosen, the homeowners are awarded a HighLIGHTing 2024 Light Up Ocoee sign to keep as a ‚ÄúThank You‚Äù for their participation and efforts to spread the holiday cheer in our community. We welcome the community and your family to drive around town or maybe just a walk in your neighborhood to see the lights. The following areas/subdivisions were awarded with a sign. Family Movie Night City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host Family Movie Night. Event Date To Be Announced. Join us for food trucks, games, a Community Market, and a Movie. For more information contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Valentines Day City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host a Valentine‚Äôs Celebration. Event Date To Be Announced. The event will be held at the Withers-Maguire House and Ocoee Lakeshore Center. Come join us for live music, painting, games, a special dance, and much more. For more information, contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Downtown Block Party City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host a Block Party in Downtown Ocoee on McKey Street. Event Date To Be Announced. Come out for live music, food trucks, and family-friendly activities. For more information, contact Adrian Dorsey or Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Annual Chick-Fil-A 5k City of Ocoee and Chick-fil-A will host their 15th Annual 5K on To Be Announced, starting at 7:30 am. There will also be a free Kids Fun Run, vendors, and other activities. The event will take place in Bill Breeze Park, which is down by the lake. To register, visit Chick-fil-A 5K and Kids Fun Run. For more information, Email Tracy Wise-Donahey or contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. Following the 5K, the Family Fun Day will take place at Bill Breeze Park from 9:00 am to 12:00 pm. This event will feature free games, rides, and activities for families to enjoy. There will also be live performances by local schools and groups. For more information, please contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180 Breakfast with the Easter Bunny City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host Breakfast with the Easter Bunny. Event Date To Be Announced. The event will be held at the Ocoee Lakeshore Center. Breakfast. Visit the Easter Bunny, his special guest, and take pictures. All kids will be able to interact with the Easter Bunny and his special guest, along with exclusive use of the Fun Zone. For more information, contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180 . Annual Easter Eggstravaganza City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host its Annual Easter Eggstravaganza. Event Date To Be Announced. This free event will be held at Bill Breeze Park. There will also be exciting games, crafts, and of course, an appearance by the Easter Bunny. For more information, contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180 . 4th of July City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services July 4th Event. Event updates to come. For more information, contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180 Family Recreation Day City of Ocoee Parks and Leisure Services will host Family Recreation Day. The event will be at the Jim Beech Recreation Center and Family Aquatic Center from 11:00 am-2:00 pm, For more information, contact Parks and Leisure Services at 407-905-3180. At this year's Family Recreation Day, Greater Vision Enterprise and Inspire will hold their 4th Annual Back to School Bash. The Back to School Bash will be hosted by Greater Vision Resources from 11:00 am-2:00 pm, for food, fun, pool, water slides, and entertainment for the entire family. Orlando Family Events Calendar ‚Äì Things to Do with Kids in Central Florida Discover the Orlando Family Events Calendar , your go-to guide for things to do with kids and families in Central Florida. From exciting Orlando festivals, family-friendly fairs, and seasonal holiday events to local story times, free community activities, and weekend fun across Orange, Seminole, Osceola, Lake, and Volusia counties, our calendar makes it easy to plan memorable outings. Whether you‚Äôre looking for kid-friendly events, indoor play, outdoor adventures, or special attractions like theme park happenings, our Central Florida events calendar Images by Blue Sunglass Photos With our Orlando Family Events Calendar , you can easily filter events by category to find exactly what fits your family‚Äôs needs. Browse holiday celebrations, free and low-cost events, back-to-school activities, seasonal festivals, and so much more. You can also filter by venue, city, cost, or even check out our featured events to quickly discover what‚Äôs happening near you. You can view listings by the day to plan their schedule, flip through different days to explore new opportunities, or switch to the monthly calendar view for a big-picture look at everything happening across Orlando and Central Florida. If you‚Äôre hosting a family-friendly event, you can even submit it directly to our calendar here . Want to have events and news deliverd to your inbox, click here to sign up for our weekly newsletters! Be sure to always double and triple check dates, times, and details of any event before heading out, as event producers may make last-minute changes without notifying us, and occasional errors may occur when loading events into the calendar. We're happy you're here! This website was designed to assist families with finding resources, ideas and things to do within the Central Florida community. We encourage all families to check and double check all events, information and news prior to making decisions for their families because, while we strive for perfection, information, news, events, and details always will and do change. Our website contains paid, non-paid, and in-trade mentions, articles, and reviews of organizations, events, schools and businesses throughout Central Florida. These mentions are for informational purposes only and should not be considered an endorsement. Please do further research on your own before choosing an event, organization, school or business to engage with. Families and individuals using our site assume all risks from any activities they participate in. MyCentralFloridaFamily.com, Epic Expos, Inc., their employees and owners are not responsible for any injuries or issues that come from participating in any of the events or opportunities listed on our website or social pages. All users/readers/visitors to MyCentralFloridaFamily.com agree to hold Epic Expos, Inc. and all of it's entities harmless in any such claims.
